title: Ute Harder
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Ute Harder**

Ute Harder, aka Frau Jenson, moved to Hamburg, [Germany](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Germany) for university studies after unsatisfying jobs with a pharmacy and then a paper manufacturer. Another year followed with a variety of jobs including the great experience as a scenery assistant at the 'Ohnsorg Theater' in Hamburg. In 1994 she studied [Illustration](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Illustration) and Communication design at the University of Applied Science in Hamburg. In the typography classes of [Jovica Veljovic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jovica%20Veljovic) she 'got infected by the typevirus'. In 1999 she digitized ' [Marathon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Marathon)', a hot metal typeface originally designed by [Rudolf Koch](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rudolf%20Koch) which received special mention at 'Kurt Christians Förderpreis'-Contest. Marathon is licensed to the [Linotype Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype%20Library) GmbH. Frau Jenson graduated with the 'Diplom-Designer FH' in 2002 and since she is working as a freelance graphic designer, collaborating on diverse projects for Linotype and developing her own fonts. Frau Jenson lives and works in Hamburg.

Type designs by Ute Harder: [Marathon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.linotype.com/58042/marathon-family.html), [Alpha Initials](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/alphainitials.html), [Cilati](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/cilati.html), [Frau Jenson People](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/fjpeople.html), [Tulda](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/tulda.html), [Bastyan](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=bastyan&face=bastyan), [Alpha Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20130921041847/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=alpharoman&face=alpharomanpro)
author: paul d hunt
